p: Prussian blue analogues (PBAs) are characterized by a rigid open framework and consist of transition metals and cyano-bridges. They have been utilized in various applications such as electrochemical sensing [ 1, 2], energy storage [ 3, 4], and energy harvesting [ 5]. Among them, the energy storage application has aroused the most attention because of the stable cyclic performance and rate capability of PBAs [ 6]. The energy loss of PBA-based batteries throughout their chargeâ€“discharge cycle is lower than that of conventional battery materials [ 7, 8], and the batteries have fast charging and discharging rates [ 9]. Because PBAs can function in the presence of various alkaline ions and even multivalent ions, various ion-based batteries have been developed [ 10]. In addition, PBA-based batteries can harvest low-grade heat energy because of their high energy efficiency [ 5, 11, 12].
